summary: The concept of "continuous assessment" pertains to the ongoing evaluation of student performance within the framework of educational organization, as outlined in EU legal and regulatory documents. This approach emphasizes the systematic and iterative nature of "assessment," allowing for real-time feedback and adjustment of teaching methodologies. Continuous assessment is integral to fostering a comprehensive understanding of learners' progress, enhancing educational outcomes, and ensuring compliance with EU standards for quality education. As a redirect to the preferred term "assessment," it underscores the importance of consistent evaluation mechanisms in the organization of teaching, promoting a holistic educational environment.
